name: Ratanak
header: Ratanak is a 29-year-old man from Cambodia who needs $150 to remove a pterygium in his eye.
description:
Meet Ratanak, a 29-year-old married man who lives in Cambodia. To earn a living, Ratanak sells clothes at the market, and he enjoys watching soccer on television and playing baseball in his free time.

Our medical partner, Children’s Surgical Centre (CSC), tells us, “Ratanak has a pterygium in his right eye that is very uncomfortable and makes it difficult to do his job and watch TV.”

A pterygium is a triangular growth of tissue in the eye that extends from the inner or outer corner of the eye toward the center. The tissue appears as a thin or thick, white or pink membrane on the surface of the eye. It often is not noticeable until it begins to cover the iris—the colored portion of the eye. A person with a pterygium may experience eye redness and discomfort and blurry vision.

The recommended treatment for Ratanak is surgical removal of the pterygium. $150 covers the cost of surgery, medication, and post-operative follow-up care. After surgery, CSC says that Ratanak “will no longer have burning sensations in his eye.”

Ratanak looks forward to feeling better and returning to work. Let’s help make it happen!
